Delays in reducing debt can erode the value of firms, to the detriment of both creditors and taxpayers. This Note proposes an auction scheme dubbed Accord-for Auction-based Creditor Ordering by Reducing Debts. Firms pay creditors in sequence as their operating cash flows permit rather than on a promised schedule. Creditors bid for position in the queue by the proportion of debt they forgive, choosing between smaller or more deferred repayments. The outcome: a firm with serviceable debt, controlled by existing owners with an incentive to operate it efficiently.
